title: Jane Goodall
subtle:
Biography (nonfiction), 773 words, Level O (Grade 2), Lexile 820L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     I and L
description: Jane Goodall is the fascinating biography of a woman who devoted her life to studying and helping the chimpanzees of Africa. This book gives students an introduction to her study of chimpanzee communities and her work to save and protect the forests that are their natural habitat. Detailed photographs of Ms. Goodall throughout her life enhance the text.
highFrequencyWords: Africa, apes, behavior, chimpanzees, field study, observations, preserve, scientist, species
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Vowel Digraphs : Identify vowel digraphs ea and ee
awareness: Past-Tense Verbs                : Recognize and use regular past-tense verbs
phonics: Homophones                : Identify and understand the use of homophones
grammar:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
